p: To many epidemiologists in other countries, this sounded unusual. In principle, “herd immunity” can be achieved by gradual infection. But it is used in public health practice primarily as a principle that prevents mass population infection by vaccination. If everyone needs to be infected to reach that threshold, then “herd immunity” is simply a consequence of mass infection, as if the health care system did not even exist, leading to an unpredictable number of victims [ 36].
